title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Sept. 10)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Recent home sales in Abington include a Colonial on 165 Oak St. sold for $622,500.
In Acton, a condo town house at 123 Skyline Drive sold for $860,000.
A one-family garrison in Arlington on Williams St. was purchased for $1,335,750.

title: Here’s who will be on the ballot for November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Boston voters selected City Council candidates for the general election set for November 4, narrowing down contenders.
At-large candidates Ruthzee Louijeune, Julia M. Mejia, and Erin J. Murphy lead the race with over 16% of the votes each.
Gabriela Coletta Zapata secured a strong lead in District 1 with 76.96% of the vote, significantly ahead of her challengers.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu leads Josh Kraft by over 45 percentage points in the preliminary mayoral election.
Wu and Kraft will proceed to the November election, while Robert Cappucci and Domingos DaRosa are eliminated.
Preliminary election saw nearly 18% voter turnout, with over 75,000 ballots cast according to Boston Elections Department.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: San Francisco venture capitalist Cindy Bi sues surrogate Rebecca Smith after miscarriage, alleging negligence in viral surrogacy lawsuit.
Bi and Smith's initially cordial relationship deteriorated after Smith's miscarriage, leading to legal and social media battles.
Smith faced harassment and job loss following miscarriage; Bi accused of defamation and vigilante incitement.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns healthy for Bruins’ training camp after missing 65 games due to a fractured patella.
Lindholm aims to improve Bruins’ power play, which ranked 29th in the NHL last season with a 15.2% success rate.
Bruins ended 2024-25 season with a 33-39-10 record, missing Lindholm's contributions on defense and offense.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh Allen praised Patriots QB Drake Maye, calling him a 'bright kid' with impressive skills on a podcast.
Drake Maye has been compared to Josh Allen for his arm strength and ability to gain rushing yards.
Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards in New England's season-opening loss to the Raiders.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: MBTA introduces a vintage maroon and yellow Boston and Maine Railroad train for the Commuter Rail this week.
Two additional trains honoring New Haven Railroad and New York Central Railroad will enter service by year-end.
The refurbished F40 trains include modern upgrades like remote monitoring, forward-facing cameras, and enhanced control systems.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Miami Dolphins signed former Patriots offensive lineman Cole Strange from the Cleveland Browns' practice squad.
Cole Strange, drafted 29th by the Patriots in 2022, played 29 games but was impeded by injuries and inefficiencies.
Strange could play in the Dolphins' Week 2 game against the Patriots after Miami's starting guard injury in Week 1.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University to offer free tuition for families earning less than $150,000 annually starting next fall.
Students from families earning under $60,000 will receive aid packages without student loans at Tufts.
The Tufts Tuition Pact is part of a $143 million annual financial aid expansion funded by donor contributions.

title: Aunt now caring for young daughter of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: David Minasvand, 31, killed Nadia Abrahamian, 80, and Karine Asatryan, 35, in a Watertown murder-suicide this month.
Their 1-year-old daughter, Madeline, will be cared for by her aunt, according to a newly established fundraiser.
The community fundraiser has collected over $37,000 to support Madeline's needs, including future education expenses.
